question:
Which two signs should be interchanged to correct the given equation?
$4\div8+5-6\times2=34$

Invested at a certain annual simple interest rate, a sum of money increases by 75% in 10 years. At the same annual simple interest rate, by what percentage will the same sum of money increase in 6 years?

The difference between the interests earned on a sum of money invested for three years at a rate of 20% per annum compounded annually and for the same period at a rate of 20% per annum simple interest is ₹448. Find the value of the sum invested.
Which of the following tropical cyclones hit the west coast of India in May 2021?
The Constituent Assembly constituted a Drafting Committee under the chairmanship of Dr. B. R. Ambedkar to prepare the draft constitution for India on which date?
In a certain code language, 'RELATIONS' is written as 'TSRONLIEA', and 'NUMBER' is written as 'URNMEB'. How will 'SPECULATION' be written in the same code language?
According to the modern periodic table, which of the following elements has an atomic number of 30?
Select the letter-group from the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series. AURT, BWSV, CYTX, ?
Ram gives a discount of 10% on the marked price of an article and still makes a profit of 12.5%. If he sells the article at the marked price only, then what would be his profit percentage?
In an examination held in a class, Ramesh's rank is 16th from the top and 21st from the bottom. If only 21 students passed the examination, then how many students in his class failed?

Select the option that has the same relationship with the fifth letter-group as the second letter-group has with the first letter-group and the fourth letter-group has with the third letter-group. MDT PAW :: RFQ UCT :: LSK:?
According to the Renewable Fuel Association, which country was the world's largest ethanol producer in the year 2020?
In which state is the Bodo language mainly spoken in India?
The Sahitya Akademi was formally inaugurated by the Government of India on 12 March in which year?
How much time will a 450 m long train running at a speed of 54 km/h take to cross a person standing on the platform?

Find the value of the following expression.

$1-\frac{(4\div5-1\times3+2)\times8}{3^{2}\times8-4\times2}$
What is sublimation?
options: Change of a substance directly from solid to gaseous state
Change of a substance directly from gaseous to solid state
Change of a substance directly from gaseous to liquid state
Change of a substance directly from liquid to gaseous state

question: Who defeated Mahmud Khalji in Chittorgarh and erected the Victory Tower?
If $y=\sqrt[3]{6}-4\sqrt[3]{6}$, then find the value of $y^{3}+12y^{2}+48y+100$.
In a certain code language, 'CONSUME' is written as 'CEMNOSU' and 'COMPEL' is written as 'CELMOP'. How will 'ENGLISH' be written in the same code language?
The editor of a women's magazine, 'Vambodhini Patrika' was ____.
The average of 30 numbers is 55. The average of the first 15 numbers is 51 and the average of the last 12 numbers is 56. What will be the average of 68, 74 and the remaining 3 numbers?

Which of the following can be defined as 'the process in which the government sells the majority of its stakes to one or more companies, while still retaining ownership and remaining a minority stakeholder'?

Six persons - C, D, E, X, Y and Z, each of a different age. Only one person is younger than Y. X is older than E, but younger than D. E is older than Y. Neither D nor C is the oldest. How many persons are older than Z?

In a certain code language
'see their dresses' is written as 'ti ve su',
'dresses we see' is written as 'nx ti ve',
'we see their party' is written as 'fs ve nx su'.
(Note: All code words are coded as two-letter code words only)
What is the possible code word for 'party dresses' in the given code language?
Which of the following internet protocols allows us to access data on the World Wide Web?

Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Considering that the information given in the statements is true, even if it seems to be different from commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow from the statements?
Statements:
All camels are donkeys.
Some cats are camels.
All dolphins are cats.
Conclusions:
I. All dolphins are donkeys.
II. Some dolphins are donkeys.
III. Some donkeys are cats.
IV. All cats are donkeys.
options: Both conclusions I and III follow.
Both conclusions I and II follow.

question: A group of 6 persons A, B, C, D, E and F (not necessarily in the same order). D is taller than A and E. F is taller than B and C. E is taller than F. A is taller than F. Which of the following can be the shortest person?
One-tenth of a two-digit number is 15 less than half of that number. What will be the sum of the digits of that two-digit number?

Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Considering that the information given in the statements is true, even if it seems to be different from commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow from the statements?
Statements:
All salsas are jazz.
No jazz is kathak.
Conclusions:
I. Some jazz are salsa.
II. No salsa is kathak.
If 1st January 2017 was a Thursday, then which day of the week was 31st March in the same year?

Eight colleagues - K, L, M, N, O, P, Q and R are sitting in a circular arrangement facing the center. N is sitting exactly between L and Q. P is sitting exactly between K and R. O is sitting second to the right of K. Which of the following is definitely true about M's position?
options: Exactly in the middle of O and P
Exactly in the middle of K and O
Exactly in the middle of Q and R
Second to the left of L

question: The world's largest river island, Majuli, is located on which of the following rivers?
Select the number from the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series. 86, 74, 62, 54,?, 42, 38

Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Considering that the information given in the statements is true, even if it seems to be different from commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow from the statements?
Statements:
Some athletes are businessmen.
All businessmen are rich.
Conclusions:
I. Some athletes are rich.
II. No athlete is rich.
options: Both conclusions I and II follow.
Neither conclusion I nor II follows.

question: G, M, P, V, Z and D are six members of a family. Z is the son of V. M is the brother of V. D and V are a married couple. P is the daughter of D. D is the sister of G. What is the relation of Z to P?
For which of her novels was Valeria Luiselli awarded the International Dublin Literary Award 2021?

Refer to the following letter, number, symbol series and answer the question given below:
(Left) KL % Y &4E23M &7SW#82HL (Right)
If all the numbers are removed from the series, then which of the following will be eighth from the right?

Simplify the following expression.

$\frac{12-6\div2+4}{3^{2}\times3-7+6}$

Giridhar was in a temple and his face was towards the west. He turns $45^{\circ}$ in the clockwise direction to take a token, then turns another $180^{\circ}$ in the clockwise direction. Then he turns $45^{\circ}$ in the anticlockwise direction. Now in which direction is his face?
Which of the following works of Kalidasa is based on the context of the birth of Kartikeya, the son of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati?

Eight persons M, N, P, S, T, V, X and Y are sitting in a straight line and all are facing north. N is sitting second from one of the ends of the line. Only three persons are sitting between M and N. P is sitting second to the right of M. As many persons are sitting to the right of P as are sitting to the left of S. Only three persons are sitting between T and S. T is not sitting at any of the ends of the line. Y is sitting to the immediate right of X. Who is sitting third to the left of V?

P, Q, R can do a piece of work in 40 days, 90 days and 36 days respectively. P starts the work. Q joins him after 7 days. If R joins them after 8 days from the beginning, then for how many days does R work?
The Central Pollution Control Board was established by the government in which year?
Which institution was awarded the Africa Food Prize 2021 for the Tropical Legumes Project, which improved income and food production in sub-Saharan Africa?
options: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT)

question: As per the information received till December 2021, what is the total number of nuclear power plants in India?
Who became India's 69th Chess Grandmaster at the Biel Masters Open on August 3, 2021?

In a certain code language,
'good deeds pay' is written as 'ag bi tr',
'pay all bills' is written as 'od ez ag',
'all your deeds count' is written as 'sn tr od um'.
(Note: All code words are coded as two-letter code words only)
How is 'count' written in the same code language?
Which of the following is the oldest production unit of Indian Railways?
Which state inaugurated the 'Aqua Bazaar' and 'Aqua Hub' project on 21 November 2020 to enhance fish consumption?
If 2sin $y+cos~y=\sqrt{5}sin~y$, then find the value of tan y.

Find the difference between the mode and mean of the following observations.
$4,5,6,7,8,12,9,12,5,12$
There are five girls in a group, each of a different height. H is shorter than only E. F is not as tall as P. P is shorter than G. Who among them is the shortest?
Which of the given options is the approximate nearest value that will come in place of the question mark (?) in the following equation? $499.37+1.95\times4.79-2.87\div19.70=?$
In a certain code language, 'MUSIC' is written as 'LTTJD', and 'CONCEPT' is written as 'BNMDFQU'. How will 'SINGING' be written in the same code language?
Fundamental duties were incorporated in the Indian Constitution in which year?

A right circular cone is placed on top of a hemisphere. The base radius of the cone is equal to the radius of the hemisphere. The diameter of the hemisphere is 12 cm, while the height of the cone is 8 cm. Find the cost of painting the combined object, if the cost of painting is ₹25 per $\pi~cm^{2}$.

A person covers a certain distance at a certain speed. If he increases his speed by 30%, he takes 15 minutes less to cover the same distance. Find the time taken by him to cover the distance at his original speed.
If $\frac{1}{1+tan~\theta}+\frac{1}{1-tan~\theta}=4$, where $0^{\circ}<\theta<90^{\circ}$, then find the value of $(cosec^{2}\theta+sec^{2}\theta)$.
Which of the following is a writ or order issued by a superior court to a lower court or tribunal or public authority to perform a public duty that it has failed to perform?
According to the Human Development Index Ranking (2020), which of the following countries has the highest life expectancy at birth (in years)?
When did the Maharashtra government launch the 'Jail Tourism' initiative?

In each of the given number-pairs, the second number is obtained by performing a certain mathematical operation on the first number. Three of the following number-pairs follow the same pattern and thus form a group. Select the number-pair that does not belong to that group.
The Champaran Satyagraha took place in which year?

Six persons A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting around a circular table facing the centre. B is sitting second to the right of E. C is sitting to the immediate left of E. F is sitting second to the right of D. Who is sitting third to the right of A?

In a class, every student secured a different rank. Aman's rank is 11th from the top and Nikhil's rank is 13th from the bottom. Only three students are ranked between Aman and Nikhil. If the total number of students is an odd number divisible by 3, then how many total students are there in the class?

Eight persons E, H, M, P, S, T, Y and Z are sitting in a straight line. All of them are facing north. E is sitting fourth from one of the ends of the line. H is sitting third to the right of E. As many persons are sitting to the right of H as are sitting to the left of M. Only one person is sitting between M and P. S is sitting to the immediate right of Z. Only one person is sitting between Z and T. How many persons are sitting to the left of Y?

The ratio of the marked price and the cost price of an article is 5:3. If the selling price of the article is ₹3,024 and the shopkeeper gives two successive discounts of 16% and 20% on it, then what is the profit or loss (in ₹)?
On calculating the interest compounded annually, a certain sum invested at compound interest amounts to ₹56,180 after 2 years, and ₹59,550.80 after 3 years. Find the sum (in ₹).
IPCC is the United Nations body for assessing the science related to climate change. What is the full form of IPCC?
If $\frac{2}{3}$ of y is equal to $\frac{8}{15}$ of z, then find the value of y : z.
Which of the following characters is used to create an absolute address in MS-Excel?

Which of the following is the SI unit of electric charge that is equal to the charge contained in approximately $6\times10^{18}$ electrons?

Eight persons P, Q, R, S, T, U, V and W are sitting around a square table for dinner in such a way that 4 persons sit at each of the four corners and 4 persons sit at the middle positions of each of the four sides. All of them are facing the centre of the square. S is sitting to the immediate left of U. U is sitting to the immediate left of T. T is sitting at the middle position of one of the sides. R is sitting third to the right of U. P is sitting exactly between V and R. W is not sitting next to T.

Which of the following is sitting at one of the corners?

Out of a total sum of ₹ 5,000, Danish invests a part of it at 12% annual simple interest rate and the remaining part at 10% annual simple interest rate. If the total interest received by Danish in two years is equal to ₹1072, then how much sum did Danish invest at 12% annual simple interest rate?

Five boxes K, L, M, N and O are arranged by placing one above the other. Box M is placed above box N. Box O is placed below box K. Box N is placed above box K. Box L is placed below box O. Which of the following boxes is placed at the bottom?

The radius of the base of a conical tent is 9 m and its height is 12 m. If the cost of the material used in making it is ₹100 per $\pi~m^{2}$, then find the total cost of the material required to make the tent.
A man can complete a piece of work in 20 days and a woman can complete the same work in 30 days. In how many days will 2 men and 3 women complete that work?

The same pattern is followed in all the three number-groups. Select the number from the given options that can come in place of the question mark (?) in the third number-group. 11, 8, 5, $9=43$  12, 9, 7, $6=66$  14, 13, 9, $10=?$

$72-4(40+24\div8\times6-4\times4)+20$

options: rate of change in consumption with change in income
change in saving per unit change in income

question: If 23.5% of a number is equal to 11.75, then find the number.

question: Popularly known as Alla Rakha, Allarakha Qureshi was an Indian ____ player.

Statement:
$W=H\ge G=C\ge T\le L\le M$
Conclusions:
I. $T\le W$
II. $C\ge M$
options: Both conclusions I and II are true.

question: The festival called Lhabab Dhuechen in Sikkim marks the descent of which deity from heaven to earth?

S, V and O are in class 9, 7 and 3, respectively. S is the tallest and in the highest class. X is taller than Y but shorter than V. T is in a class senior to Y but junior to V. X is in a class senior to V. Who is in a class senior but shorter than V? [cite: 20, 21, 22]

options: Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management Act [cite: 44]
Fiscal Relations and Budget Maintenance Act [cite: 44]
Financial Responsibility and Budget Maintenance Act [cite: 45]

question: Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series. 132, 129, 124, 117, 108, ? [cite: 46, 47]

There are four people sitting in a room. When asked a question, each of them gives two answers. Only two out of the four people give one right answer and one wrong answer, while other two persons give both answers wrong. When asked about the day today, person 1 says its Wednesday or Sunday. Person 2 says its Monday or Saturday. Person 3 says its Tuesday or Friday. And person 4 says its Thursday or Wednesday. What is the day today? [cite: 80, 81, 82, 83, 84]

Study the given information carefully and answer the question that follows. The administration has set the following criteria for the selection of a teacher in school. The candidate must: A. Be a graduate with at least 50% marks B. Have a qualified bachelor's degree in education C. Not be less than 21 Years and not more than 32 years as on 1st July 2021. D. For a candidate with Master in Education, the school board may relax the upper age limit. Rahul Verma is teaching in a reputed school He is a 1st class graduate. He was 23 years old when he joined the previous school as a teacher. He has also completed B.Ed. What decision should be taken for Rahul Verma? [cite: 90, 91, 92, 93]
options: The data given are not sufficient to take a decision. [cite: 94]
The case is to be referred to the school board. [cite: 95]
The candidate is to be appointed. [cite: 96]
The candidate is not to be appointed. [cite: 95]

question: Ten people are sitting in two parallel rows 1 and 2. J, K, L, M and N are sitting in row 1 facing south, and Q, R, S, T and U are sitting in row 2 facing north, in such a way that each member in row 1 faces a member of row 2. Only two people sit to the left of Q. J faces an immediate neighbour of Q. M sits to the immediate left of J. The one who faces K sits to the immediate left of S. Neither K nor S sit at any of the extreme ends. Only two people sit between S and T. N faces an immediate neighbour of U. Who faces R? [cite: 96, 97]
Who was the first political personality to discuss the concept of 'Poverty Line'? [cite: 101]

A, B, C D J, K, L and M are sitting around a square table facing the centre of the table. Four of them are sitting at either of the corners while the other four are sitting at the exact centre of either of the sides. D sits at one of the corners of the table. Only two people sit between D and C, when counted from the left of D. Only three people sit between C and B. M sits third to the left of B. K sits to the immediate right of M. A is neither an immediate neighbour of B nor C. J sits to the immediate left of A. Who sits second to the right of L? [cite: 102, 103, 104, 105]

Read the given statement and conclusions carefully. Decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statement. Statement: R is not the mother of P. P is the daughter of S. and S has three daughters. Conclusions: I. P is the sister of R II. S is the mother of P. [cite: 110, 111, 112]
options: Neither conclusion I nor II follows [cite: 112]
Both conclusions I and II follow [cite: 114]

question: A question is given, followed by two statements labelled I and II. Identify which of the statements is/are sufficient/necessary to answer the question. Question: On which day does Sujatha's birthday fall? Statements: I. Tom correctly remembers that her birthday comes after Tuesday but before Saturday. II. Anu correctly remembers that her birthday comes before Thursday but after Monday. [cite: 117, 118, 119, 120]
options: Both statements I and II together are sufficient to answer the question [cite: 121]
Statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question [cite: 122]
Neither statement I nor II is sufficient to answer the question [cite: 122]
Statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question [cite: 123]

options: It maintains an equilibrium between export and import. [cite: 142]

question: Rupali goes to office from her house via a specific route. Initially, she travels 17 km towards the north, then turns right towards the east and travels 15 km. From here, she again takes a right turn and travels 17 km. Now, she turns left and travels 7 km and finally reaches her office. In which direction and how many km away (considering the shortest distance) is she from her house? (All turns are 90° turns only) [cite: 147, 148, 149, 150, 151, 152]

Eight people M, N, P, S, T, V, X and Y are sitting in a straight row and all are facing north. M sits third from one of the extreme ends of the line. N sits second to the right of M. As many people sit to the right of N as to the left of P. S sits third to the right of P. X sits to the immediate right of Y. Only one person sits between X and V. How many people sit to the right of T? [cite: 156, 157, 158]
